page.title: 13Wrecks
page.content: Because of the treacherous and unstable local sandbanks this part of the coast has an infamous reputation amongst seamen. There have been innumerable wrecks on Corton beach over the years, one of the earliest, the Sainte marie in 1369, being despoiled by men from the village. In the 19th century a lifeboat and rocket (breeches buoy) crew were established here to aid stranded ships.The rocket shed still survives as the garage of 24a The Street.Corton also had its own beach company,an association of men who salvaged wrecks and their contents for the prize money.
